basics.summary: Final-year BSc student in Artificial Intelligence with hands-on research experience at EPFL BioRob and top AI labs. Research focuses on representation learning, multi-modal LLMs, and continual learning.

work.name: LAMP - CVC - UAB
highlights: Investigating catastrophic forgetting and cross-modal interference in Unified Multi-Modal LLMs.
Developing a comprehensive benchmark suite to evaluate model performance on sequential tasks.

work.name: IRI - UPC
work.summary: Future Action Prediction in Video Models
highlights: Investigating modern state-space architectures (e.g., Mamba) for modeling long-range temporal dependencies in future action prediction from video.

work.name: BioRob - EPFL
highlights: Developed a context-aware interaction framework (based on SkateFormer) to resolve spatial user intent in multi-robot scenarios, outperforming geometric baselines by significant margins.
Proposed an Implicitly Guided Geometric Fusion strategy that embeds robot coordinates into skeletal graphs, achieving robust generalization to unseen/occluded layouts.
Curated a 10k-sample dataset and deployed the end-to-end pipeline on a ROS2-based mobile swarm, achieving 25ms latency for real-time closed-loop control.

work.name: PayRetailers
highlights: Developed and analyzed AI agents using advanced context engineering, studying how prompting strategies affect model behavior and output quality.
Designed complex multi-agent workflows through n8n, documenting emergent behaviors and interaction patterns in orchestrated systems.
Designed B2B products that automate and simplify the work of other departments, such as pricing calculators, RAG chatbots, conversation analyzers, report generators.
Exchange semester as part of BSc program
